A Bit About Me

I'm a web developer and programmer based in the Greater Toronto Area. I recently graduated from Sheridan College. I spend my time learning different technologies to improve my skillset and enjoy making video games as a hobby.

Whether through coding or a paint brush, the expressing of ideas stems from simple structures and patterns. To mediate this, is what I enjoy most about designing.

Science and technology has often been compared to magic. Realizing my code to solve problems and making fun things is an amazing feeling that could be equated to magic.

Every time I start a new project is a chance for education. Whether that involves a new stack or a new design pattern, I view the whole thing as an oppurtunity. No matter how small, every endeavor is a learning experience.
